title: Viasat won’t replace damaged Americas satellite, moves up financial targets
summary: Viasat shares rose on Thursday after the company said it expects to meet financial growth targets earlier than expected and that it won’t need to replace a damaged $750 million communications satellite.

title: Scientists excited by first look at OSIRIS-REx asteroid samples
summary: Scientists said they are thrilled with an initial assessment of asteroid samples returned by a NASA spacecraft last month even though they still don’t know how much material that mission brought back to Earth.

title: Second SpaceForest Perun Flight Aborted After Engine Failure
summary:
Polish space tech company SpaceForest announced 11 October that the second flight of its suborbital Perun launch system had failed. Despite the failure, the company recovered the rocket and intends to return it to the launchpad. Perun is a single-stage guided suborbital rocket powered by a hybrid rocket engine. The rocket stands 11.5 metres tall […]
The post Second SpaceForest Perun Flight Aborted After Engine Failure appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Intelsat signs multi-launch contract with Relativity Space
summary: Satellite operator Intelsat has signed an agreement with Relativity Space for multiple launches of that company’s Terran R reusable launch vehicle under development.

title: NASA Begins Analysis of Samples from One Asteroid as it Readies Launch to Another
summary: NASA officials refer to this as Asteroid Autumn and they’re not kidding. Today they revealed the first samples that were just returned from the asteroid Bennu by the OSIRIS-REx spacecraft […]

title: Italy’s Argotec to design, build, test and operate satellites in Maryland
summary: Italian space company Argotec announced plans Oct. 11 to invests $25 million in a manufacturing facility in Largo, Maryland.

title: U.S. to pursue stronger collaboration with allies in military space programs
summary: U.S. and allies "have been discussing ways to jointly architect systems and build capabilities together to avoid duplication and ensure interoperability"

title: NASA finds water and organics in asteroid sample—possible clues to origin of life
Debris-removal contenders hit design milestone for double-satellite mission
summary: The two contenders hoping the U.K. chooses them to de-orbit a pair of derelict satellites in 2026 with a single robotic spacecraft have finished the system requirements review for their mission.

title: CNES Selects HEMERIA to Produce 90 Research Balloons
summary:
CNES has renewed its contract with aerospace and defense company HEMERIA to produce stratospheric balloons for the French space agency’s scientific campaigns. Signed on 11 October, the agreement will see HEMERIA produce 50 open stratospheric balloons, including the main balloons and associated auxiliary balloons, and 40 pressurized stratospheric balloons. The agreement will span four years. […]
The post CNES Selects HEMERIA to Produce 90 Research Balloons appeared first on European Spaceflight.
